page.title: List of official trips made by Edi Rama

revision.text:
This is a '''list of official trips made by [[Edi Rama]]''' as the [[List of Prime Ministers of Albania|33rd]] [[Prime Minister of Albania|Prime Minister]] of the [[Albania|Republic of Albania]]. == 2013 == The following international trips were made by Prime Minister Edi Rama in 2013: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flag icon|Kosovo}} [[Kosovo]] |[[Pristina]] |{{sort|2013-09-13|13 September}} |Prime Minister Rama [[state visit]] to Kosovo was his first trip outside [[Albania]] as Prime Minister. Rama chose neighboring [[Kosovo]] as the first foreign trip of his office in a demonstration of the historic and strategic ties between the two countries.{{cite web|title=Rama becomes new Albania PM|url=http://www.enca.com/world/rama-becomes-new-albania-pm|website=enca.com|language=English|date=15 September 2013}} Rama was welcomed by [[Prime Minister of Kosovo]], [[Hashim Thaçi]]. |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2013-09-17|17 September}} |Rama travelled to Brussels in order to attend the [[European Commission]] focused on the following steps of [[Albania]] into the [[Accession of Albania to the European Union|European Union]] and on the state of play of the country's commitment to reform in the light of this process.{{cite web|title=Visit of Edi Rama, Albanian Prime Minister, to the EC|url=http://ec.europa.eu/avservices/photo/photoByReportage.cfm?ref=023948|location=Brussels|language=English|date=17 September 2013}} Rama met the [[President of the European Commission]], [[José Manuel Barroso]] and the Member of the European Commission in charge of Enlargement and European Neighbourhood Policy, [[Štefan Füle]]. |- |{{Flag icon|United States}} [[United States]] |[[New York City]] |{{sort|2013-09-21|21-23 September}} |Rama flew to New York City in order to attend the [[United Nations General Assembly]].{{cite web|title=Rama nis vizitën e parë të tij si kryeministër në SHBA, fjalim në OKB|url=http://www.arkivalajmeve.com/Rama-nis-viziten-e-pare-te-tij-si-kryeminister-ne-SHBA-fjalim-ne-OKB.1047441637/|website=arkivalajmeve.com|language=Albanian|date=21 September 2013}} [[Edi Rama]] met [[Hillary Clinton|Hillary]] and [[Bill Clinton]] upon their invitation.{{cite web|title=Rama: Takim emocionuese mes Bill dhe Hillary Clinton|url=http://www.civitas.al/al/politike/rama-takim-emocionues-me-bill-dhe-hillary-clinton|website=civitas.al|language=Albanian|date=24 September 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kosovo}} [[Kosovo]] |[[Pristina]]
[[Prizren]] |{{sort|2013-10-26|23 October}} |Rama and [[Prime Minister of Turkey]], [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] was invited by the [[Prime Minister of Kosovo]], [[Hashim Thaçi]] to attend the open ceremony of the Terminal of [[Pristina International Airport]].{{cite web|title=Erdogan çrregullon Ballkanin!|url=http://old.zeri.info/artikulli/18780/erdogan-crregullon-ballkanin|website=zeri.info|language=Albanian|date=26 October 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|Macedonia}} [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]] |[[Skopje]] |{{sort|2013-11-5|5 November}} |Rama travelled to Macedonia on his first [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of Macedonia]], [[Nikola Gruevski]]. He also met the [[President of Macedonia]], [[Gjorge Ivanov|George Ivanov]], the Speaker of the [[Parliament of Macedonia]], [[Trajko Veljanovski]] and the two leader of the Albanian parties in Macedonia [[Ali Ahmeti]] ([[Democratic Union for Integration|BDI]]) and [[Menduh Thaçi]] ([[Democratic Party of Albanians|PDSH]]).{{cite web|last1=Pajaziti|first1=Naser|title=Albanian PM Rama to visit Skopje today|url=http://www.balkaneu.com/albanian-pm-rama-visit-skopje-today/|website=balkaneu.com|date=5 November 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|Montenegro}} [[Montenegro]] |[[Podgorica]] |{{sort|2013-11-14|14 November}} |Rama travelled to Montenegro on his first [[state visit]] to the country. Rama was invited by the [[Prime Minister of Montenegro]], [[Milo Đukanović]] and met the [[President of Montenegro]], [[Filip Vujanović]]. Rama visited the city of [[Tuzi]], where the majority is [[Albanian people|Albanian]].{{cite web|title=Edi Rama nesër në Mal të Zi|url=http://www.malesia.org/2013/11/14/edi-rama-neser-ne-mal-te-zi/#.WTWAQmjyjIU|website=malesia.org|language=Albanian|date=14 November 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]] |[[London]] |{{sort|2013-11-20|20 November}} |Rama travelled to London to met the [[Prime Minister of United Kingdom]], [[David Cameron]] focused on the integration of [[Albania]] into the [[Accession of Albania to the European Union|European Union]] and the [[Albania - United Kingdom relations|economical relations]] between the [[United Kingdom]] and [[Albania]].{{cite web|title=Londër, Rama takohet me Cameron në fokus integrimi i vendit në BE|url=http://shqiptarja.com/news.php?IDNotizia=187803&NomeCategoria=Politike&Titolo=lond-r-rama-takohet-me-cameron-n--fokus-integrimi-i-vendit-n--be&IDCategoria=2732&reply=337170|website=shqiptarja.com|language=Albanian|date=20 November 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|Austria}} [[Austria]] |[[Vienna]] |{{sort|2013-11-25|25 November}} |Rama travelled to Austria on his first [[state visit]] to the country met the [[President of Austria]], [[Heinz Fischer]] and in order to attend the 2013 Vienna Economic Forum.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Edi Rama, takim me Presidentin e Austrisë Heinz Fischer|url=http://www.kryeministria.al/al/newsroom/lajme/kryeministri-edi-rama-takim-me-presidentin-e-austrise-heinz-fischer&page=129|website=kryeministria.al|language=Albanian|date=25 November 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Rome]]
[[Bari]] |{{sort|2013-12-12|12 December}} |Rama participated to a bilateral meeting in Rome with the [[Prime Minister of Italy]], [[Enrico Letta]], focused on the economical, and cultural relations between both countries.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Rama nesër në Romë, takon homologun Enrico Letta|url=http://time.ikub.al/f66ad942cb/f48c561243c79e87a6c0049f15a7ae4a/lajm.aspx|website=time.ikub.al|language=Albanian|date=11 December 2013}} |- |{{Flag icon|Azerbaijan}} [[Azerbaijan]] |[[Baku]] |{{sort|2013-12-16|16-17 December}} |Rama travelled to Azerbaijan on his first [[state visit]] to the country met the [[Ministry of Energy (Azerbaijan)|Ministry of Energy of Azerbaijan]], [[Natig Aliyev]]. Rama was invited to attend a ceremony to sign final investment document on Shahdeniz-2.{{cite web|title=Albanian Premier Edi Rama arrives in Azerbaijan|url=http://en.trend.az/azerbaijan/politics/2222297.html|website=trend.az|language=English|date=16 December 2013}} (See also: [[Albania-Azerbaijan relations]]) |- |{{Flag icon|Israel}} [[Israel]] |[[Jerusalem]] |{{sort|2013-21|21 December}} |Rama participated to a bilateral meeting in Jerusaelm with the [[Prime Minister of Israel]], [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]. Rama and Netanyahu signed a declaration of friendship to mark the [[Albania-Israel relations|25th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations]].{{cite web|title=Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama in Israel|url=http://embassies.gov.il/MFA/PressRoom/2015/Pages/Albanian-Prime-Minister-Edi-Rama-in-Israel-21-Dec-2015.aspx|website=embassies.gov.il|language=English|date=21 December 2013}} |} == 2014 == The following international trips were made by Prime Minister Edi Rama in 2014: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Rome]] |{{sort|2014-1|1-2 February}} |Rama participated to a [[Albania-Italy relations|bilateral meeting]] in Rome with the [[Prime Minister of Italy]], [[Enrico Letta]], focused on the economical, and cultural relations between both countries.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Rama në Itali: Shqipëria, horizont i ri mundësish për investitorët italianë|url=http://gazeta-shqip.com/lajme/2014/02/02/kryeministri-rama-ne-itali-shqiperia-horizont-ri-mundesish-per-investitoret-italiane/|website=gazeta-shqip.com|language=Albanian|date=2 February 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Germany}} [[Germany]] |[[Berlin]] |{{sort|2016-1|1 April}} |Rama flew to Germany upon the invitation of [[Chancellor of Germany]], [[Angela Merkel]], focused on the [[Albania-Germany relations|bilateral relations]] between both countries.{{cite web|title=Rama and Merkel to meet in Berlin|url=https://www.ata.gov.al/en/rama-and-merkel-to-meet-in-berlin/|website=ata.gov.al|language=English|date=31 March 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Qatar}} [[Qatar]] |[[Doha]] |{{sort|2014-14|14 April}} |Rama flew to Qatar on his first [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of Qatar]], [[Abdullah bin Nasser bin Khalifa Al Thani|Khalifa Al Thani]] focused on the bilateral relations of Albania and Qatar.{{cite web|title=Rama në Katar: Marrëveshjet hapin një kapitull i ri bashkëpunimi|url=http://shqiptarja.com/news.php?IDNotizia=209592&NomeCategoria=politike&Titolo=rama-n--katar-marr-veshjet-hapin-nj--kapitull-i-ri-bashk-punimi&IDCategoria=2732&reply=372343|website=shqiptarja.com|language=Albanian|date=13 April 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Holy See}} [[Vatican City|Vatican]]
{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Vatican City]]
[[Rome]] |{{sort|2014-24|24 April}} |Rama travelled to Vatican on his first [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of the [[Pope Francis]].{{cite web|title=Edi Rama takim në Vatikan me Papën|url=http://objektiv.al/edi-rama-takim-ne-vatikan-me-papen/|website=objektiv.al/|language=Albanian|date=25 April 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kazakhstan}} [[Kazakhstan]] |[[Astana]] |{{sort|2014-24|24 May}} |Rama flew to Kazakhstan on his first [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[President of Kazakhstan]], [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]] focused on the economic relations of Albania and Kazakhstan.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Rama vizitë zyrtare në Kazakistan, takohet me Presidentin Nursultan Nazarbayev|url=http://www.kryeministria.al/al/newsroom/lajme/kryeministri-rama-vizite-zyrtare-ne-kazakistan-takohet-me-presidentin-nursultan-nazarbayev|website=kryeministria.al|language=Albanian|date=24 May 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Netherlands}} [[Netherlands]] |[[Amsterdam]] |{{sort|2014-26|26 May}} |Rama travelled to the Netherlands in order to attend a bilateral meeting upon the invitation of [[List of Ministers of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands|Minister of Foreign Affairs]], [[Frans Timmermans]].{{cite web|title=Vizita e kryeministrit Edi Rama ne Holande|url=http://www.arkivalajmeve.com/Vizita-e-kryeministrit-Edi-Rama-ne-Holande.1047587857/|website=arkivalajmeve.com|language=Albanian}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2014-11|11 June}} |Rama travelled to France on his [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[President of France]], [[François Hollande]] focused on the integration of [[Albania]] into the [[Accession of Albania to the European Union|European Union]] and the [[Albania-France relations|bilateral relations of Albania and France]].{{cite web|title=Hollande receives Rama in Paris|url=http://top-channel.tv/english/artikull.php?id=12041|website=top-channel.tv|language=English|date=11 June 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Germany}} [[Germany]] |[[Berlin]] |{{sort|2014-28|28 August}} |Rama travelled to Germany in order to attend the [[2014 Conference of Western Balkan States, Berlin|2014 Western Balkans summit]] in Berlin. |- |{{Flag icon|Croatia}} [[Croatia]] |[[Zagreb]] |{{sort|2014-26|26 August}} |Rama flew to Croatia in order to attend a bilateral meeting with [[Prime Minister of Croatia]], [[Zoran Milanović]], [[Prime Minister of Montenegro]], [[Milo Djukanovic]] and [[Prime Minister of Bosnia and Herzegovina]], [[Vjekoslav Bevanda]] and as well focused on their friendly relations.{{cite web|title=rama-ne-kroaci-duhet-te-behemi-bashke-unaza-e-medheut-domosdoshmeri-per-integrimin|url=http://www.panorama.com.al/rama-ne-kroaci-duhet-te-behemi-bashke-unaza-e-medheut-domosdoshmeri-per-integrimin/|website=panorama.com.al|language=Albanian|date=26 May 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Wales}} [[Wales]]
{{Flag icon|NATO}} [[NATO]] |[[Newport, Wales|Newport]] |{{sort|2014-4|4 September}} |Rama travelled to Wales in order to attend the [[2014 Wales summit]] of the [[North Atlantic Treaty Organization]] (NATO). |- |{{Flag icon|China}} [[China]] |[[Beijing]] |{{sort|2014-10|10-11 September}} |Rama travelled to China in order to attend a [[Albania China relations|bilateral meeting]] with [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Prime Minister of China]], [[Li Keqiang]].{{cite web|title=Rama vizitë dy ditore në Kinë: Për projekte në infrastrukturë dhe energji|url=https://www.ata.gov.al/rama-vizite-dy-ditore-ne-kine-per-projekte-ne-infrastrukture-dhe-energji/|website=ata.gov.al|language=Albanian|date=8 September 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Rome]] |{{sort|2014-1|1-2 February}} |Rama participated to a [[Albania-Italy relations|bilateral meeting]] for the second time in 2014 in Rome with the [[Prime Minister of Italy]], [[Enrico Letta]], focused on the economical, and cultural relations between Albania and Italy.{{cite web|title=Rama në Itali: Hapësirat me qira për një euro në vit, rritje 30% të eksporteve|url=http://noa.al/lajmi/2014/09/443127.html|website=noa.al|language=Albanian|date=28 September 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Serbia}} [[Serbia]] |[[Belgrade]] |{{sort|2014-10|10 November}} |Prime Minister Rama travelled to Serbia on his first official [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of Serbia]], [[Aleksandar Vučić]]. Rama was pursuing a historical reconciliation policy between Albanians and Serbs and his visit in Belgrade. It was the first visit of an Albanian Prime Minister in Serbia in over 70 years.{{cite web|title=Vizita historike në Serbi, Rama tha në shqip: Kosova, e pavarur!|url=http://shqiptarja.com/home/1/vizita-historike-n--serbi-rama-tha-n--shqip-kosova-e-pavarur--251338.html|website=shqiptarja.com|language=Albanian|date=10 November 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Sweden}} [[Sweden]] |[[Stockholm]] |{{sort|2014-14|14 November}} |Rama flew to Sweden in order to attend a bilateral meeting with [[Prime Minister of Sweden]], [[Stefan Löfven]].{{cite web|title=Suedia mbështetje të forte Shqipërisë dhe reformave modernizuese|url=https://www.ata.gov.al/suedia-mbeshtetje-te-forte-shqiperise-dhe-reformave-modernizuese/|website=ata.gov.al|language=Albanian|date=14 November 2014}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kuwait}} [[Kuwait]] |[[Kuwait City]] |{{sort|2014-19|19-20 November}} |Rama travelled to Kuwait on his [[state visit]] to the country to attend a bilateral meeting with ruler [[Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah]] and other Kuwaiti politicians.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri i Shqipërisë Edi Rama vizitë zyrtare në Kuvajt|url=http://aa.com.tr/sq/bota/kryeministri-i-shqip%C3%ABris%C3%AB-edi-rama-vizit%C3%AB-zyrtare-n%C3%AB-kuvajt/99887|website=aa.com.tr|language=Albanian|date=19 November 2014}} |} == 2015 == The following international trips were made by Prime Minister Edi Rama in 2015: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flag icon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]] |[[London]] |{{sort|2015-18-01|18 January}} |Rama was invited to attend the ''Potential Monuments of Unrealised Futures'' ''([[Albanian language|Albanian]]: Monumente të Mundshëm Ardhmërisht të Parealizuara)'' exhibition at the [[Architectural Association School of Architecture]] of Albanian artists Edi Hila and Adrian Paci.{{cite web|title=Rama në Londër: Ekspozita e artistëve, rast që Shqipëria të shihet me sy tjetër|url=http://noa.al/lajmi/2015/01/464240.html|website=noa.al|language=Albanian|date=18 January 2015}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2015-11-01|11 January}} |Rama was invited in order to attend the [[Republican marches]] to honour the victims of the [[Charlie Hebdo shooting]], with the leaders of the Sunni, Orthodox, Bektashi, and Catholic communities of Albania.{{cite web|title=Rama prezanton bashkëjetesën fetare shqiptare në marshimin në Paris|url=http://www.kosovaonline.info/arkiva/ballina/rama-prezanton-bashkejetesen-fetare-shqiptare-ne-marshimin-ne-paris#.WVJT1WjyjIU|website=kosovaonline.info|accessdate=11 January 2015|language=Albanian}} |- |{{Flag icon|United Arab Emirates}} [[United Arab Emirates]] |[[Dubai]] |{{sort|2014-11|14-16 April}} |Rama travelled to the United Arab Emirates in order to participate to a bilateral meeting with the Head of the Dubai Council, [[Mohammad Al-Murr]] and the [[List of Prime Ministers of the United Arab Emirates|Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates]], [[Sheikh Mansour]].{{cite web|title=Rama në Emiratet e Bashkuara Arabe|url=http://gazeta-shqip.com/lajme/2015/04/14/rama-ne-emiratet-e-bashkuara-arabe/|website=gazeta-shqip.com|language=Albanian|date=14 April 2015}} |- |{{Flag icon|Romania}} [[Romania]] |[[Bucharest]] |{{sort|2014-11|11 June}} |Rama participated to a [[Albania-Romania relations|bilateral meeting]] in Romania with the [[Prime Minister of Romania]], [[Victor Ponta]] focused on the economical, and cultural relations between both countries and the [[International recognition of Kosovo|recognition of Kosovo]].{{cite web|title=Rama vizitë në Bukuresht, kërkon njohjen e Kosovës nga Rumania|url=https://www.ata.gov.al/rama-ne-bukuresht-marreveshje-me-rumanine-per-mbrojtjen-sociale/|website=ata.gov.al|language=Albanian|date=27 February 2015}} |- |{{Flag icon|Austria}} [[Austria]] |[[Vienna]] |{{sort|2015-4|27 August}} |Rama travelled to Austria in order to attend the [[2015 Western Balkans Summit, Vienna|2015 Western Balkans summit]] in Vienna. |- |{{Flag icon|United States}} [[United States]] |[[New York City]] |{{sort|2013-09-24|24-29 September}} |Rama flew to New York City in order to attend the 2015 [[World Leadership Forum]] as well as the 2015 [[Columbia University|Columbia University World Leader Forum]].{{cite web|title=Javën e ardhshme, Rama vizitë 5 ditore në SHBA|url=http://shqiptarja.com/m/diplomaci/javen-e-ardhshme-rama-vizite-5-ditore-ne-shba-316372.html|website=shqiptarja.com|language=Albanian|date=20 September 2015}} |- |{{Flag icon|Czech Republic}} [[Czech Republic]] |[[Prague]] |{{sort|2015-10-13|13 October}} ||Rama travelled to the Czech Republic on his first [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of the Czech Republic]], [[Bohuslav Sobotka]].{{cite web|title=Rama, vizitë zyrtare në Republikën Çeke|url=http://klankosova.tv/rama-vizite-zyrtare-ne-republiken-ceke/|website=klankosova.tv|accessdate=13 October 2015|language=Albanian}}{{cite web|title=Çeki-Shqipëri, marrëdhënie dinamike. Nënshkruhen 5 marrëveshje bashkëpunimi|url=http://www.kryeministria.al/al/newsroom/lajme/ceki-shqiperi-marredhenie-dinamike-nenshkruhen-5-marreveshje-bashkepunimi&page=61|website=kryeministria.al|accessdate=13 October 2015|language=Albanian}} |- |{{Flag icon|China}} [[China]] |[[Suzhou]] |{{sort|2014-11|24 November}} |Rama flew to China in order to attend the 2015 summit of China and Central and Eastern European Countries in [[Suzhou]]. |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Istanbul]] |{{sort|2014-11|18-20 November}} |Rama travelled to Turkey in order to attend the 2015 [[Atlantic Council|Atlantic Council Energy and Economic summit]] in Istanbul.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Rama në Stamboll|url=http://www.abcnews.al/lajme/politike/1/63616|website=abcnews.al|language=Albanian|date=19 November 2015}} |- |{{Flag icon|China}} [[China]] |[[Hong Kong]] |{{sort|2014-11|27 October}} |Rama participated to a [[Albania China relations|bilateral meeting]] in Hong Kong with the [[Chief Executive of Hong Kong]], [[Leung Chun-ying]]. Rama also was invited to attend the Economic Forum of Albania and China.{{cite web|title=Edi Rama, Gent Sejko dhe Samir Mane shkojnë në Hong Kong|url=http://noa.al/lajmi/2015/10/524208.html|website=noa.al|language=Albanian|date=24 October 2015}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2014-3|3 December}} |Rama travelled to France on his [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of France]], [[Manuel Valls]] focused on the [[Albania-France relations|bilateral relations]] of Albania and France.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Edi Rama zhvillon vizitë zyrtare në Francë me ftesë të Kryeministrit francez Manuel Valls|url=http://www.ambasadat.gov.al/france/sq/kryeministri-edi-rama-zhvillon-vizit%C3%AB-zyrtare-n%C3%AB-franc%C3%AB-me-ftes%C3%AB-t%C3%AB-kryeministrit-francez-manuel|website=ambasadat.gov.al|language=Albanian|date=2 December 2015}} |} == 2016 == The following international trips were made by Prime Minister Edi Rama in 2016: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flag icon|United States}} [[United States]] |[[Washington, D.C.]] |{{sort|2016-04-14|13-14 April}} |Rama travelled to on hist [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[President of the United States]], [[Barack Obama]] and [[List of Vice Presidents of the United States|Vice President of the United States]], [[Joe Biden]].{{cite web|title=Edi Rama nis vizitën në SHBA|url=http://www.abcnews.al/lajme/politike/1/69582|website=abcnews.al|accessdate=11 April 2016|language=Albanian}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2016-4|30 May}} |Rama travelled to on hist [[state visit]] to the country, where he met the [[President of France]], [[François Hollande]].{{cite web|title=Takim me Z. Edi Rama, Kryeministri i Shqipërisë|url=https://al.ambafrance.org/Takim-me-Z-Edi-Rama-Kryeministri-i-Shqiperise|website=al.ambafrance.org|language=Albanian|date=1 June 2016|quote=Presidenti i Republikës, Z. François Hollande u takua me Kryeministrin e Shqipërisë, Z. Edi Rama më 30 maj 2016.}} |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Ankara]] |{{sort|2016-28|28 June}} |Rama travelled to Turkey on his [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[President of Turkey]], [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]], focused on the strong [[Albania-Turkey relations|bilateral relations]] between both countries.{{cite web|title=Sulmi ne aeroportin Ataturk - Rama në Turqi: Gjithçka ok, nesër vizita zyrtare në Ankara|url=http://www.oranews.tv/vendi/kryeministri-rama-ndodhet-ne-turqi-bushati-denon-sulmin-terrorist/|website=oranews.tv|language=Albanian|date=28 June 2016}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2016-4|4 July}} |Rama travelled to France in order to attend the [[2016 Western Balkans Summit, Paris|2016 Western Balkans summit]] in Paris. |- |{{Flag icon|Poland}} [[Poland]]
{{Flag icon|NATO}} [[NATO]] |[[Warsaw]] |{{sort|2016-07-08|8-9 July}} |Rama travelled to Poland in order to attend the [[2016 Warsaw summit]] of the [[North Atlantic Treaty Organization]] (NATO). |- |{{Flag icon|Slovenia}} [[Slovenia]] |[[Lubljana]] |{{sort|2016-28|5 September}} |Rama flew to Slovenia on his [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of Slovenia]], [[Miro Cerar]], focused on the strong [[Albania-Slovenia relations|bilateral relations]] between both countries and as well the integration of [[Albania]] into the [[Accession of Albania to the European Union|European Union]].{{cite web|title=Edi Rama-Miro Cerar: Sllovenia mbështet Shqipërinë për negociatat në BE|url=http://24-ore.com/?p=105032|website=24-ore.com|accessdate=5 September 2016|language=Albanian}} |- |{{Flag icon|Serbia}} [[Serbia]] |[[Belgrade]] |{{sort|2016-14|14-15 October}} |Rama flew to Serbia on his [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Prime Minister of Serbia]], [[Aleksandar Vučić]] and in order to attend the 2016 Belgrade Security Forum.{{cite web|title=Vizita e kryeministrit Edi Rama ne Beograd|url=http://www.ambasadat.gov.al/serbia/sq/vizita-e-kryeministrit-edi-rama-ne-beograd|website=ambasadat.gov.al|language=Albanian|quote=Në datat 13-14 tetor 2016 kryeministri Edi Rama kreu një vizitë dy ditore në Republikën e Serbisë.}} |- |{{Flag icon|Germany}} [[Germany]] |[[Berlin]] |{{sort|2016-28|28 November}} |Rama travelled to Germany on his [[state visit]] to the country upon the invitation of [[Chancellor of Germany]], [[Angela Merkel]], focused on the strong [[Albania-Germany relations|bilateral relations]] between both countries and as well the integration of [[Albania]] into the [[Accession of Albania to the European Union|European Union]].{{cite web|title=PM Rama arrives in Berlin for official visit to Germany|url=https://www.ata.gov.al/en/pm-rama-arrives-in-berlin-for-official-visit-to-germany/|website=ata.gov.al|language=English|date=28 November 2016}}{{cite web|title=Bundeskanzlerin Merkel empfängt den Ministerpräsidenten der Republik Albanien, Edi Rama|url=https://www.bundeskanzlerin.de/Content/DE/Pressemitteilungen/BPA/2016/11/2016-11-25-bkin-albanien-breg.html|website=bundeskanzlerin.de|accessdate=25 November 2016|language=German}} |} == 2017 == The following international trips were made by Prime Minister Edi Rama in 2017: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flag icon|Singapore}} [[Singapore]] |[[Singapore]] |{{sort|2017-01-018|18 January}} |Rama flew to Singapore on his official [[state visit]] to the country meeting the [[Prime Minister of Singapore]], [[Lee Hsien Loong]], focused on the bilateral relations of both countries and the [[International recognition of Kosovo]].{{cite web|title=Rama vizitë në Singapor|url=http://rtsh.al/lajme/rama-vizite-ne-singapor/|website=rtsh.al|language=Albanian|date=18 January 2017}} |- |{{Flag icon|Kosovo}} [[Kosovo]] |[[Pristina]] |{{sort|2017-02-02|2 February}} |Rama travelled to Kosovo on his official [[state visit]] to the country where he met the [[Prime Minister of Kosovo]], [[Isa Mustafa]]. |- |{{Flag icon|Bosnia and Herzegovina}} [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]] |[[Sarajevo]] |{{sort|2017-03-16|16 March}} |Rama travelled to Bosnia and Herzegovina in order to attend the Western Balkans Six Leaders Summit in Sarajevo.{{cite web|author1=[[Prime Minister of Albania]]|title=Sarajevo Summit|url=http://www.kryeministria.al/en/newsroom/news/sarajevo-summit|website=kryeministria.al|language=English|date=16 March 2017}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2017-29|29 March}} |Prime Minister Rama travelled to France on his [[state visit]] to the country, where he met [[Prime Minister of France]], [[Bernard Cazeneuve]] focused on the [[Albania-France relations|bilateral relations]] between Albania and France. Both have signed a series of agreements elevating the framework of bilateral cooperation.{{cite web|title=Rama in Paris, strategic partnership declaration Albania – France|url=https://europeanwesternbalkans.com/2017/03/29/rama-in-paris-strategic-partnership-declaration-albania-france/|website=europeanwesternbalkans|language=English|date=29 March 2017}}
Edi Rama received the order of the “[[Legion of Honour|Commander to the Legion of Honour]]”, the highest French Honour by [[President of France]], [[François Hollande]].{{cite web|title=PM Edi Rama received Légion d'Honneur title by French President|url=http://m.top-channel.tv/lajme/english/artikull.php?id=19663|website=top-channel.tv|language=English|date=29 March 2017}} |- |{{Flag icon|Montenegro}} [[Montenegro]] |[[Podgorica]] |{{sort|2017-3|3 April}} |Rama travalled to Montenegro on his [[state visit]] to the country, where he met [[Prime Minister of Montenegro]], [[Duško Marković]] focused on the bilateral relations between the two countries as well as Albania's support as a member of the [[North Atlantic Treaty Organisation]] on Montenegro's integration into the NATO.{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Rama fillon vizitën zyrtare në Mal të Zi|url=http://www.ekonomiaonline.com/globi/rajon/kryeministri-rama-fillon-viziten-zyrtare-ne-mal-te-zi/|website=ekonomiaonline.com|location=Pristina, Kosovo|language=Albanian|date=3 April 2017}} |- |{{Flag icon|Switzerland}} [[Switzerland]] |[[Bern]] |{{sort|2017-6|6 April}} |Rama participated to a bilateral meeting in Bern with the [[President of Switzerland]], [[Doris Leuthard]], focused on the economical, and cultural relations between both countries. The two countries celebrated the 25th anniversary of intensely collaboration.{{cite web|title=Official Visit of Edi Rama in Bern|url=http://www.schweiz-albanien.ch/en/2017/04/official-visit-of-edi-rama-in-bern/|website=schweiz-albanien.ch|language=English|date=7 April 2017}} |- |{{Flag icon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]]
{{Flag icon|NATO}} [[NATO]] |[[Brussels]] |{{sort|2013-05-25|25 May}} |Rama travelled to Belgium in order to attend the [[2017 Brussels summit]] of the [[North Atlantic Treaty Organization]] (NATO). |- |{{Flag icon|Turkey}} [[Turkey]] |[[Istanbul]] |{{sort|2017-07-10|9-10 July}} |Rama flew to Turkey in order to attend the [[World Petroleum Council|2017 World Petroleum Congress]].{{cite web|title="Shqipëria, fronti i ri i naftës"|url=https://www.vizionplus.tv/rama-ne-kongresin-boteror-te-naftes-ne-stamboll/|website=vizionplus.tv|accessdate=10 July 2017|language=Albanian|quote=Kryeministri Rama, i cili ndodhet në Stamboll në Kongresin Botëror të naftës, u shpreh se Shqipëria ka rezerva të pashfrytëzuara nafte dhe se në të ardhmen, vendi mund të bëhet fronti i ri i naftës në botë.}}{{cite web|title=Kongresi i botëror i naftës, Rama ‘mburret’ me projektet e Berishës dhe i merr edhe sloganin|url=http://www.syri.net/politike/78619/kongresi-i-boteror-i-naftes-rama-mburret-me-projektet-e-berishes-dhe-i-merr-edhe-sloganin/|website=syri.net|accessdate=10 July 2017|language=Albanian|quote=Kryeministrit Edi Rama është duke marrë pjesë në kongresin botëror të naftës.}} Rama also meet the [[President of Turkey]], [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]].{{cite web|title=Kryeministri Rama takon Presidentin turk Erdogan|url=http://www.kryeministria.al/al/newsroom/lajme/kryeministri-rama-takon-presidentin-turk-erdogan|website=kryeministria.al|language=Albanian|date=9 July 2017|quote=Kryeministri Rama do t'i adresohet Kongresit në sesionin qendror, me pjesëmarrjen e Presidentit të Turqisë, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, presidentë e kryeministra nga vende të ndryshme, si dhe të aktorëve e faktorëve të rëndësishëm në këtë industri.}} |- |{{Flag icon|Italy}} [[Italy]] |[[Trieste]] |{{sort|2017-07-12|12 July}} |Rama travelled to Italy in order to attend the [[2017 Western Balkans Summit, Trieste|2017 Western Balkans summit]] in Trieste.{{cite web|title=Balkan states sit in endless EU waiting room as Trieste summit begins|url=http://www.dw.com/en/balkan-states-sit-in-endless-eu-waiting-room-as-trieste-summit-begins/a-39632991|website=dw.com|language=English|date=11 July 2017|quote=Wednesday's summit in Trieste will focus most heavily on financial programs, akin to a Marshall Plan for the Balkans. Where the money would come from remains to be seen, meaning that while some Balkan politicians have rejoiced over the announcement of increased funding, they have also expressed concern.}}{{cite web|title=Shqipëria në Trieste, Rama: Mbështesim zonën ekonomike rajonale|url=http://top-channel.tv/lajme/artikull.php?id=359402|website=top-channel.tv|language=Albanian|date=12 July 2017|quote=Shqipëria do të mbështesë krijimin e një zone ekonomike të përbashkët rajonale dhe Edi Rama do ta mbrojë këtë qëndrim edhe në Samitin e Triestes, ku përveç liderwve të Ballkanit, do të marrin pjesë edhe kancelarja gjermane Angela Merkel dhe presidenti francez Emanuel Macron.}} |- |{{Flag icon|Montenegro}} [[Montenegro]] |[[Podgorica]] |{{sort|2017-08-2|2 August}} |Rama travelled to Montenegro in order to attend the [[Adriatic Charter|2017 Adriatic Charter summit]] in Podgorica.{{cite web|title=Montenegro to hosts special meeting of members of US - Adriatic Charter (A5)|url=http://www.gov.me/en/News/173927/Montenegro-to-hosts-special-meeting-of-members-of-Atlantic-Charter-A5.html|website=gov.me|language=English|date=29 June 2017}}{{cite web|title=Rama në samitin e Kartës së Adriatikut, zbardhet takimi me homologun malazez|url=http://www.politiko.al/2017/08/rama-ne-samitin-e-kartes-se-adriatikut-zbardhet-takimi-homologun-malazez/|website=politiko.al|language=Albanian|date=2 August 2017}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |{{sort|2017-08-01|1-2 September}} |Prime Minister Rama travelled to France on his [[state visit]] to the country, where he met [[President of France]], [[Emmanuel Macron]] focused on the [[Albania-France relations|bilateral relations]] between Albania and France. He also attend the 2017 Global Positive Forum in [[Paris]].{{cite web|title=Rama merr pjese në "Global Positive Forum"|url=https://www.vizionplus.tv/rama-merr-pjese-ne-global-positive-forum/|website=https://www.vizionplus.tv/rama-merr-pjese-ne-global-positive-forum/|language=Albanian|date=1 September 2017|quote=Kryeministri Edi Rama ka marre pjese ne forumin ekonomik te zhvilluar ne France.}} |- |{{Flag icon|USA}} [[United States]] |[[New York City]] |{{sort|2017-09-18|18-25 September}} |Prime Minister Rama travelled to the United States in order to attend the [[Seventy-second session of the United Nations General Assembly|72nd]] Session of the [[United Nations General Assembly]]. |} == Future trips == The following international trips are scheduled to be made by Edi Rama during 2017: {| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date ! width=550|Details|- |- |{{Flag icon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]] |[[London]] |{{sort|2018-07-01|July 2018}} |Prime Minister Rama is scheduled to attend the [[2018 Western Balkans Summit, London|2018 Western Balkans summit]] in [[London]]. |} == See also == * [[Edi Rama]] * [[Prime Minister of Albania]] * [[Politics of Albania]] == References == {{reflist|30em}} {{Navboxes | title = [[File:Coat_of_arms_of_Albania.svg|20x20px]] Topics related to [[Prime Minister of Albania]] | titlestyle = color:black; background-color:white; |list1= {{Albanian government}} {{Foreign relations of Albania}} }} {{Portal bar|Albania}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential trips made by Edi rama}} [[Category:21st century-related lists]] [[Category:2013 in international relations]] [[Category:2014 in international relations]] [[Category:2015 in international relations]] [[Category:2016 in international relations]] [[Category:2017 in international relations]] [[Category:Diplomatic visits by heads of government|Rama, Edi]] [[Category:State visits by Albanian leaders]] [[Category:Foreign relations of Albania]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:Lists of diplomatic trips|Rama, Edi]]

revision.comment: /* Impact of Prime Meridian ( Greenwich Time) */
revision.text:
{{About||the astronomical concept|Meridian (astronomy)|other uses|Meridian (disambiguation){{!}}Meridian}} {{more citations needed|date=July 2018}} [[File:Primemeridian.jpg|thumb|300px|Meridians run between the North and South poles.]] A ('''geographical''') '''meridian''' (or '''line of longitude''') is the half of an imaginary [[great circle]] on the Earth's surface, terminated by the [[North Pole]] and the [[South Pole]], connecting points of equal [[longitude]], as measured in angular degrees east or west of the Prime Meridian.<ref>{{Citation|title=“Absurd Vanity”: The World’s Prime Meridians before c. 1790|date=2017|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt1n2ttsj.6|work=Zero Degrees|pages=25–72|editor-last=WITHERS|editor-first=CHARLES W. J.|series=Geographies of the Prime Meridian|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=9780674088818|access-date=2018-07-25}}</ref> The position of a point along the meridian is given by that longitude and its [[latitude]], measured in angular degrees north or south of the [[Equator]]. Each meridian is perpendicular to all [[circle of latitude|circles of latitude]]. Each is also the same length, being half of a great circle on the Earth's surface and therefore measuring 20,003.93 km (12,429.9 miles).
== Pre-Greenwich == The first prime meridian was set by [[Eratosthenes]] in 276 BCE. This prime meridian was used to provide measurement of the earth, but had many issues because of the lack of latitude measurement.<ref>{{Citation|title=“Absurd Vanity”: The World’s Prime Meridians before c. 1790|date=2017|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt1n2ttsj.6|work=Zero Degrees|pages=25–72|editor-last=WITHERS|editor-first=CHARLES W. J.|series=Geographies of the Prime Meridian|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=9780674088818|access-date=2018-07-26}}</ref> Many years later around the 19th century there was still concerns of the prime meridian. The idea of having one prime meridian came from [[William Parker Snow]], because he realized the confusion of having multiple prime meridian locations. Many of theses geographical locations were traced back to the ancient Greeks, and others were created by several nations.<ref>{{Citation|title=PROLOGUE|date=2017|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt1n2ttsj.4|work=Zero Degrees|pages=1–4|editor-last=WITHERS|editor-first=CHARLES W. J.|series=Geographies of the Prime Meridian|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=9780674088818|access-date=2018-07-25}}</ref> Multiple locations for the geographical meridian meant that there was inconsistency, because each country had their own guidelines for where the prime meridian was located.
==Etymology== The term ''meridian'' comes from the Latin ''meridies'', meaning "midday"; the [[subsolar point]] passes through a given meridian at solar [[noon]], midway between the times of sunrise and sunset on that meridian.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=qnQDAAAAQAAJ&pg=PA61&lpg=PA61&dq=The+term+%22meridian%22+comes+from+the+Latin+meridies,+meaning+%22midday%22;+th&source=bl&ots=23Ptfdvd3h&sig=frtap1TC1R4OuIo5KJ9i5sTuBZ8&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiMqqTTg8HcAhUQLHwKHRbiBL4Q6AEwDXoECAMQAQ#v=onepage&q=The%20term%20%22meridian%22%20comes%20from%20the%20Latin%20meridies,%20meaning%20%22midday%22;%20th&f=false|title=First Teachings about the Earth; its lands and waters; its countries and States, etc|last=|first=|date=1870|publisher=|year=|isbn=|location=|pages=|language=en}}</ref> Likewise, the [[Sun]] crosses the [[meridian (astronomy)|celestial meridian]] at the same time. The same Latin stem gives rise to the terms [[12-hour clock|a.m. (ante meridiem) and p.m. (post meridiem)]] used to disambiguate hours of the day when utilizing the [[12-hour clock]].
== Geographic == [[File:Prime_meridian.jpg|link=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Prime_meridian.jpg|right|thumb|The astronomic prime meridian at Greenwich, England. The geodetic prime meridian is actually 102.478 meters east of this point since the adoption of [[WGS84]].]]Toward the ending of the 19th century there were two main locations that were acknowledged as the geographic location of the meridian, France and Britain. These two locations often conflicted and a settlement was reached only after there was an International Meridian Conference held, in which Greenwich was recognized as the 0° location.<ref>{{Citation|title=Ruling Space, Fixing Time|date=2017|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt1n2ttsj.12|work=Zero Degrees|pages=263–274|editor-last=WITHERS|editor-first=CHARLES W. J.|series=Geographies of the Prime Meridian|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=9780674088818|access-date=2018-07-26}}</ref>
The meridian through [[Royal Greenwich Observatory|Greenwich (inside Greenwich Park)]], England, called the [[Prime meridian (Greenwich)|Prime Meridian]], was set at zero degrees of longitude, while other meridians were defined by the angle at the center of the earth between where it and the prime meridian cross the equator. As there are 360 [[Degree (angle)|degrees]] in a circle, the meridian on the opposite side of the earth from Greenwich, the antimeridian, forms the other half of a circle with the one through Greenwich, and is at [[180° longitude]] near the [[International Date Line]] (with land mass and island deviations for boundary reasons). The meridians from West of Greenwich (0°) to the antimeridian (180°) define the [[Western Hemisphere]] and the meridians from East of Greenwich (0°) to the antimeridian (180°) define the [[Eastern Hemisphere]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://study.com/academy/lesson/what-is-the-prime-meridian-definition-facts-location.html|title=What is the Prime Meridian? - Definition, Facts & Location - Video & Lesson Transcript {{!}} Study.com|website=study.com|language=en|access-date=2018-07-25}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|certain=|date=July 2018}} Most maps show the lines of longitude.
The position of the prime meridian has changed a few times throughout history, mainly due to the transit observatory being built next door to the previous one (to maintain the service to shipping). Such changes had no significant practical effect. Historically, the average error in the determination of longitude was much larger than the change in position. The adoption of [[WGS84]] ("World Geodetic System 84") as the positioning system has moved the [[Satellite geodesy|geodetic]] prime meridian 102.478 metres east of its last [[Geodetic astronomy|astronomic]] position (measured at Greenwich).<ref>{{Cite journal|date=2015-09-22|title=A&G Volume 56 Issue 5, Full Issue|url=https://doi.org/10.1093/astrogeo/atv173|journal=Astronomy & Geophysics|language=en|volume=56|issue=5|pages=ASTROG|doi=10.1093/astrogeo/atv173|issn=1366-8781}}</ref> The position of the current geodetic prime meridian is not identified at all by any kind of sign or marking (as the older astronomic position was) in Greenwich, but can be located using a GPS receiver.
== Impact of Prime Meridian ( Greenwich Time) == It was in the best interests of the nations to agree to one standard meridian to benefit their fast growing economy and production. The disorganized system they had before was not sufficient for their increasing mobility. The coach services in England had erratic timing before the GWT. U.S. and Canada were also improving their railroad system and needed a standard time as well. With a standard meridian, stage coach and trains were able to be more efficient.<ref>{{Cite journal|date=1976-01-01|title=Greenwich time and the prime meridian|url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0083665676900398|journal=Vistas in Astronomy|language=en|volume=20|pages=219–229|doi=10.1016/0083-6656(76)90039-8|issn=0083-6656}}</ref> The argument of which meridian is more scientific was set aside in order to find the most convenient for practical reasons. They were also able to agree that the universal day was going to be the mean solar day. They agreed that the days would begin at midnight and the universal day would not impact the use of local time. In the "Transactions of the Royal Society of Canada a report was submitted, dated 10 May 1894; on the Unification of the Astronomical, Civil and Nautical Days" it states that:
'''civil day'''- begins at midnight and ends at midnight following
'''astronomical day'''- begins at noon of civil day and continue until following noon
'''nautical day'''- concludes at noon of civil day, starting at preceding noon<ref>{{Cite journal|date=1976-01-01|title=Greenwich time and the prime meridian|url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0083665676900398|journal=Vistas in Astronomy|language=en|volume=20|pages=219–229|doi=10.1016/0083-6656(76)90039-8|issn=0083-6656}}</ref>
== Magnetic Meridian == The '''magnetic meridian''' is an equivalent imaginary line connecting the magnetic [[South magnetic pole|south]] and [[North magnetic pole|north poles]] and can be taken as the horizontal [[Component (vector)|component]] of magnetic force lines along the surface of the earth.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://web.b.ebscohost.com/ehost/pdfviewer/pdfviewer?vid=8&sid=91d6805f-0515-4459-b829-049879336d9c@sessionmgr120|title=Induction effects of geomagnetic disturbances in the geo-electric field var...: EBSCOhost|website=web.b.ebscohost.com|language=en|access-date=2018-07-25}}</ref> Therefore, a compass needle will be parallel to the magnetic meridian. However, a compass needle will not be steady in the magnetic meridian, because of the longitude from east to west being complete [[geodesic]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Haughton|first=Graves C.|date=1843|title=On the Relative Dynamic Value of the Degrees of the Compass; and on the Cause of the Needle Resting in the Magnetic Meridian. [Abstract]|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/110936|journal=Abstracts of the Papers Communicated to the Royal Society of London|volume=5|pages=626–626}}</ref> The angle between the magnetic and the true meridian is the [[magnetic declination]], which is relevant for navigating with a compass.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://web.a.ebscohost.com/ehost/pdfviewer/pdfviewer?vid=5&sid=0224ec29-46c7-45d6-ab0d-ddbccd7ba8b6@sessionmgr4006|title=RESEARCH ON MAGNETIC DECLINATION IN LITHUANIAN TERRITORY.: EBSCOhost|website=web.a.ebscohost.com|language=en|access-date=2018-07-26}}</ref> Navigators were able to use the azimuth (the horizontal angle or direction of a compass bearing)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/azimuth|title=Definition of AZIMUTH|website=www.merriam-webster.com|language=en|access-date=2018-07-28}}</ref> of the rising and setting Sun to measure the magnetic variation (difference between magnetic and true north).<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://dx.doi.org/10.4159/harvard.9780674074811|title=The Lost Art of Finding Our Way|last=Huth|first=John Edward|date=2013-01-15|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=9780674074811|location=Cambridge, MA and London, England}}</ref>
== True Meridian == The '''true meridian''' is the plane that passes through true north poles and true south poles at the spot of the observer. The difference between true meridian and magnetic meridian is that the true meridian is fixed while the magnetic meridian is formed through the movement of the needle.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.differencebetween.com/difference-between-true-meridian-and-vs-magnetic-meridian/|title=Difference Between True Meridian and Magnetic Meridian - DifferenceBetween.com|date=2011-08-14|work=DifferenceBetween.com|access-date=2018-07-28|language=en-US}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|certain=y|date=July 2018}} True bearing is the horizontal angle between true meridian and a line.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.quora.com/What-is-true-meridian|title=What is true meridian? - Quora|last=maneesh|first=kumar|date=|website=www.quora.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-07-28}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|certain=y|date=July 2018}} Henry D. Thoreau classified this true meridian versus the magnetic meridian in order to have a more qualitative, intuitive, and abstract function. He used the true meridian since his compass varied by a few degrees. There were some variations. When he noted the sight line for the True Meridian from his family's house to the depot, he could check the declination of his compass before and after surveying throughout the day. He noted this variation down.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=McLean|first=Albert F.|date=1968|title=Thoreau's True Meridian: Natural Fact and Metaphor|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/2711017|journal=American Quarterly|volume=20|issue=3|pages=567–579|doi=10.2307/2711017}}</ref>
== Meridian Passage == The '''meridian passage''' is the moment when a celestial object passes the meridian of longitude of the observer. At this point, the celestial object is at its highest point. When the sun passes two times an altitude while rising and setting can be averaged to give the time of meridian passage. Navigators utilized the sun’s declination and the sun’s altitude at local meridian passage, in order to calculate their latitude with the formula.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Huth|first=John|date=2013|title=Lost Art of Finding Our Way|url=|journal=Cambridge: Harvard University Press|volume=|pages=99–200|via=ProQuest Ebook Central}}</ref>
Latitude = (90o – noon altitude + declination)
The declination of major stars are their angles north and south from the celestial equator.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Huth|first1=John|date=2013|title=Lost Art of Finding Our Way|journal=Cambridge; Harvard University Press|volume=|pages=|pmid=|via=ProQuest Ebook Central}}</ref> It is important to note that the Meridian passage will not occur exactly at 12 hours because of the inclination of the earth. The meridian passage can occur within a few minutes of variation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.myseatime.com/discussion/what-is-the-difference-of-noon-position-and-meridian-passage|title=What is the difference of noon position and meridian passage? - MySeaTime|last=Jassal|first=Reeve|date=|website=www.myseatime.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-07-28}}</ref>
== Measurement of Earth Rotation == Many of these instruments rely on the ability to measure the longitude and latitude of the earth. These instruments also were typically effected by local gravity, which paired well with existing technologies such as the magnetic meridian.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Malys|first=Stephen|last2=Seago|first2=John H.|last3=Pavlis|first3=Nikolaos K.|last4=Seidelmann|first4=P. Kenneth|last5=Kaplan|first5=George H.|date=2015-08-01|title=Why the Greenwich meridian moved|url=https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00190-015-0844-y|journal=Journal of Geodesy|language=en|volume=89|issue=12|pages=1263–1272|doi=10.1007/s00190-015-0844-y|issn=0949-7714}}</ref>
'''Tools of Measurement'''
*Visual and Photographic Zenith Tubes *Circumzenithals *Danjon Astrolabes *Transit Telescopes - Airy Transit Circle

revision.comment: /* Road mapping and highway facility management */
revision.text:
[[File:Google_Street_View_Car_in_Honolulu.jpg|180px|thumb|right|[[Google Street View]] Car]]
'''Mobile mapping''' is the process of collecting [[geospatial]] data from a mobile [[vehicle]],<ref>Vitrià, et al. (2004) [https://books.google.com/books?id=P7FYs0IvbpoC&lpg=PA209&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA69#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.69] Retrieved June 2011.</ref> typically fitted with a range of [[photographic]], [[radar]], [[laser scanning|laser]], [[LiDAR]] or any number of [[remote sensing]] systems. Such systems are composed of an integrated array of time synchronised [[navigation]] sensors and [[Photography|imaging]] sensors mounted on a mobile platform.<ref>Hofmann-Wellenhof, B., et al. (2003) [https://books.google.com/books?id=losWr9UDRasC&lpg=PA379&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA379#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.379-380.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref> The primary output from such systems include [[GIS]] data, digital [[map]]s, and [[georeference]]d images and video.
== History ==
The development of direct reading [[georeference|georeferencing]] technologies opened the way for mobile mapping systems. [[GPS]] and [[Inertial Navigation System]]s, have allowed rapid and accurate determination of [[Location (geography)|position]] and [[:wikt:attitude|attitude]] of [[remote sensing]] equipment,<ref>Tao, C. V. (2007) [https://books.google.com/books?id=tWUfPdng_o0C&lpg=PP1&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA5#v=onepage&q&f=false p.5.] Retrieved June 2011</ref> effectively leading to direct mapping of features of interest without the need for complex post-processing of observed data.
== Applications ==
=== Aerial mobile mapping ===
Traditional [[Topographic surveying and mapping|techniques]] of geo-referencing aerial photography, [[ground profiling radar]], or [[Lidar]] are prohibitively expensive, particularly in inaccessible areas, or where the type of data collected makes interpretation of individual features difficult. Image direct georeferencing, simplifies the mapping control for large scale mapping tasks.<ref>Gao, J. (2009) [https://books.google.com/books?id=KHXSKc1bfusC&lpg=PA196&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA196#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.196.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref>
=== Emergency response planning ===
Mobile mapping systems allow rapid collection of data to allow accurate assessment of conditions on the ground.<ref>[[Sisi Zlatanova|Zlatanova]], et al. (2008) [https://books.google.com/books?id=m-2RMTpe7WEC&lpg=PA103&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA103#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.103.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref>
=== Internet applications ===
Internet, and [[mobile device]] users, are increasingly utilising geo-spatial information, either in the form of mapping, or geo-referenced imaging. Google, Microsoft, and Yahoo have adapted both aerial photographs and satellite images to develop online mapping systems. ''[[Google Street View|Street View]]'' type images are also an increasing market.<ref>Tao, C.V. (2007) [https://books.google.com/books?id=tWUfPdng_o0C&lpg=PP1&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PR13#v=onepage&q&f=false p.xiii.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref>
Location aware [[PDA]] systems rely on geo-referenced features collated from mobile mapping sources.<ref>Weng, Q. (2009) [https://books.google.com/books?id=VtXSBy4-UH0C&lpg=PA70&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA70#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.70.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref>
=== Road mapping and highway facility management ===
GPS combined with digital camera systems allow rapid update of road maps.<ref>Tao, C.V. (2009) [https://books.google.com/books?id=KHXSKc1bfusC&lpg=PA614&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA614#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.614.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref> <ref>Hammoudi et al. (2013) [https://doi.org/10.5772%2F56570 p.10.] Retrieved November 2018.</ref> <ref>Hammoudi et al. (2013) [https://dx.doi.org/10.4028/www.scientific.net/AMM.332.139 p.139-144.] Retrieved January 2016.</ref> The same system can be utilised to carry out efficient road condition surveys,<ref>Zlatanova, et al. (2008) [https://books.google.com/books?id=m-2RMTpe7WEC&lpg=PA103&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA113#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.113.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref> and facilities management.<ref>Gavrilova, M.L. (2006) [https://books.google.com/books?id=WsTq5xvLKiEC&lpg=PA997&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA996#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.996-1001.] Retrieved June 2011.</ref> [[Laser scanning]] technologies, applied in the mobile mapping sense, allow full 3D data collection of slope, bankings, etc.<ref>van Oosterom, P. (2008) [https://books.google.com/books?id=j5Vt4W69YfAC&lpg=PA7&dq=mobile%20mapping&pg=PA8#v=onepage&q=mobile%20mapping&f=false p.8.] Retrieved June 2011</ref>
== Footnotes ==
{{reflist}}
== References ==
* Tao, C. V. (2007) ''Advances in mobile mapping technology: Volume 4 of International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing book series''. Taylor & Francis. {{ISBN|0-415-42723-1}} * Gao, J. (2009) ''Digital Analysis of Remotely Sensed Imagery''. McGraw Hill Professional. {{ISBN|0-07-160465-0}}. * Zlatanova, S. & Li, J. (2008) ''Geospatial Information Technology for Emergency Response: Volume 6 of International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing book series''. Routledge. {{ISBN|0-415-42247-7}}. * van Oosterom, Peter (2008) ''Advances in 3D geoinformation systems: Lecture notes in geoinformation and cartography''. Springer. {{ISBN|3-540-72134-7}}. * Hofmann-Wellenhof, B., Legat, K., Wieser, M. (2003) ''Navigation: principles of positioning and guidance'' Springer. {{ISBN|3-211-00828-4}}. * Vitrià, J., Radeva, P., Aguiló, I. (2004) ''Recent advances in artificial intelligence research and development: Volume 113 of Frontiers in artificial intelligence and applications''. IOS Press. {{ISBN|1-58603-466-9}}. * Gavrilova, M.L. (2006) ''Computational science and its applications: ICCSA 2006 : international conference, Glasgow, UK, May 8–11, 2006 : proceedings''. Springer. {{ISBN|3-540-34072-6}}. * Weng, Q. (2009) ''Remote Sensing and GIS Integration: Theories, Methods, and Applications'' McGraw Hill Professional. {{ISBN|0-07-160653-X}}.

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/194.78.80.34|194.78.80.34]] ([[User talk:194.78.80.34|talk]]) to last version by 107.77.207.166
revision.text:
{{broader|Natural environment}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2013}} {{Biodiversity}} A '''natural landscape''' is the original landscape that exists before it is acted upon by human culture.<ref group = note>"The area prior to the introduction of man 's activity is represented by one body of morphologic facts. The forms that man has introduced are another set. We may call the former, with reference to man, the original, natural landscape. In its entirety it no longer exists in many parts of the world, but its reconstruction and understanding are the first part of formal morphonology." Carl O. Sauer, "The Morphology of Landscape". ''University of California Publications in Geography'', vol. 2, No. 2, 12 October 1925, p. 37.[https://archive.org/stream/universityofc02univ/universityofc02univ_djvu.txt]</ref> The natural landscape and the [[cultural landscape]] are separate parts of the [[landscape]].<ref group = note>"The cultural landscape is fashioned from a natural landscape by a culture group. Culture is the agent, the natural area is the medium, the cultural landscape the result." Carl O. Sauer, "The Morphology of Landscape", p. 46.</ref> However, in the twenty-first century landscapes that are totally untouched by human activity no longer exist, so that reference is sometimes now made to degrees of naturalness within a landscape.<ref group = note>The [[European Environment Agency]]'s planned forest naturalness index is an example of an attempt to define one type of natural landscape in Europe. The Agency lists forests in three categories: (1) [[Plantations]]; (2) Semi-natural; and (3) Naturally dynamic. The latter are "forests whose structure, composition and function have been shaped by natural dynamics without substantial [[Human impact on the environment|anthropogenic]] influence over a long period of time".</ref>
In ''[[Silent Spring]]'' (1962) [[Rachel Carson]] describes a roadside verge as it used to look: "Along the roads, laurel, viburnum and alder, great ferns and wildflowers delighted the traveler’s eye through much of the year" and then how it looks now following the use of [[herbicide]]s: "The roadsides, once so attractive, were now lined with browned and withered vegetation as though swept by fire".<ref>Cambridge, Mass.: Riverside Press, 1962, p. 1.</ref> Even though the landscape before it is sprayed is biologically degraded, and may well contains alien species, the concept of what might constitute a natural landscape can still be deduced from the context.
The phrase "natural landscape" was first used in connection with [[landscape painting]], and [[landscape gardening]], to contrast a formal style with a more natural one, closer to nature. [[Alexander von Humboldt]] (1769 – 1859) was to further conceptualize this into the idea of a natural landscape ''separate'' from the [[cultural landscape]]. Then in 1908 [[geographer]] [[Otto Schlüter]] developed the terms original landscape (''Urlandschaft'') and its opposite cultural landscape (''Kulturlandschaft'') in an attempt to give the science of geography a subject matter that was different from the other sciences. An early use of the actual phrase "natural landscape" by a [[geographer]] can be found in [[Carl O. Sauer]]'s paper "The Morphology of Landscape" (1925).<ref>[[Carl O. Sauer]], "The Morphology of Landscape". ''University of California Publications in Geography'' 2 (2), pp. 19-53.</ref>
==Origins of the term== The concept of a natural landscape was first developed in connection with [[landscape painting]], though the actual term itself was first used in relation to [[landscape gardening]]. In both cases it was used to contrast a formal style with a more natural one, that is closer to nature. Chunglin Kwa suggests, "that a seventeenth-century or early-eighteenth-century person could experience natural scenery ‘just like on a painting,’ and so, with or without the use of the word itself, designate it as a landscape."<ref>Chunglin Kwa, "Alexander von Humboldt's invention of the natural landscape", ''The European Legacy'', Vol. 10, No. 2, pp. 149-162, 2005</ref> With regard to landscape gardening John Aikin, commented in 1794: "Whatever, therefore, there be of ''novelty'' in the singular scenery of an artificial garden, it is soon exhausted, whereas the infinite diversity of a natural landscape presents an inexhaustible flore of new forms".<ref>J. Aikin, M.D., ''Letters from a Father to His Son, on Various Topics, Relative to Literature and the Conduct of Life. Written in the Years 1792 and 1793'', (Philadelphia: Samuel Harrison Smith), p. 148.</ref> Writing in 1844 the prominent American landscape gardener [[Andrew Jackson Downing]] comments: "straight canals, round or oblong pieces of water, and all the regular forms of the geometric mode ... would evidently be in violent opposition to the whole character and expression of natural landscape".<ref>''A Treatise on the Theory and Practice of Landscape Gardening Adapted to North America''.</ref>
In his extensive travels in South America, [[Alexander von Humboldt]] became the first to conceptualize a natural landscape separate from the cultural landscape, though he does not actually use these terms.<ref>https://www.gutenberg.org/dirs/etext05/qnct310.txt</ref><ref>[http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/routledg/cele/2005/00000010/00000002/art00002 Chunglin Kwa, Alexander von Humboldt's invention of the natural landscape, The European Legacy, Vol. 10, No. 2, pp. 149-162, 2005]</ref><ref group = note>[http://www.avhumboldt.net/humboldt/publications/paragraph/did/35/vid/38/cid/244/tid/7698/text/The-description-of-nature-in-its-manifold-richness-of-form-as-a-distinct-branch-of-poetic-literat] "The description of nature in its manifold richness of form, as a distinct branch of poetic literature, was wholly unknown to the Greeks. The landscape appears among them merely as the basil-ground of the picture of which human figures constitute the main subject. Passions, breaking forth into action, riveted their attention almost exclusively." Alexander von Humboldt ''[[Cosmos: a sketch of a physical description of the universe]]'' (translation 1804), Volume 2, Part I, Paragraph 5, Chapter I.</ref> Andrew Jackson Downing was aware of, and sympathetic to, Humboldt's ideas, which therefore influenced American landscape gardening.<ref>See ''Horticulturist'', vol.4, no.2, August 1849, which Downing edited.</ref>
Subsequently, the [[geographer]] [[Otto Schlüter]], in 1908, argued that by defining [[geography]] as a ''Landschaftskunde'' (landscape science) would give geography a logical subject matter shared by no other discipline.<ref>James, P.E & Martin, G (1981) ''All Possible Worlds: A History of Geographical Ideas.'' John Wiley & Sons. New York, p.177.</ref><ref>Elkins, T.H (1989) ''Human and Regional Geography in the German-speaking lands in the first forty years of the Twentieth Century''. Entriken, J. Nicholas & Brunn, Stanley D (Eds) ''Reflections on Richard Hartshorne's The nature of geography''. Occasional publications of the Association of the American Geographers, Washington DC., p. 27.</ref> He defined two forms of landscape: the ''Urlandschaft'' (original landscape) or landscape that existed before major human induced changes and the ''Kulturlandschaft'' (cultural landscape) a landscape created by human culture. Schlüter argued that the major task of geography was to trace the changes in these two landscapes.
The term natural landscape is sometimes used as a synonym for [[wilderness]], but for geographers natural landscape is a scientific term which refers to the [[biological]], [[geological]], [[Climatology|climatological]] and other aspects of a landscape, not the cultural values that are implied by the word wilderness.<ref>"The Trouble with Wilderness; or, Getting Back to the Wrong Nature". William Cronon, ed., ''Uncommon Ground: Rethinking the Human Place in Nature''. (New York: W. W. Norton & Co., 1995), pp. 69–90.</ref>
===The natural and conservation=== Matters are complicated by the fact that the words nature and natural have more than one meaning. On the one hand there is the main dictionary meaning for nature: "The phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features and products of the earth, as opposed to humans or human creations".<ref>"Nature", ''New Oxford American Dictionary''</ref> On the other hand, there is the growing awareness, especially since [[Charles Darwin]], of humanities biological affinity with nature.<ref>[http://education.seattlepi.com/animals-share-human-dna-sequences-6693.html "Animals That Share Human DNA Sequences", Seattlepi.com]</ref>
The [[Dualism (philosophy of mind)|dualism]] of the first definition has its roots is an "ancient concept", because early people viewed "nature, or the nonhuman world […] as a divine ''Other'', godlike in its separation from humans".<ref>Gregory H. Aplett and David N. Cole, "The Trouble with Naturalness: Rethinking Park and Wilderness Goals" in ''Beyond Naturalness: Rethinking Park and Wilderness Stewardshio in an Era of Rapid Change'' (Washington, DC.: Island Press, 2010), p. 14. They cite William Conron's 1995 essay "The Trouble with Wilderness: or, Getting Back to the Wrong Nature".</ref> In the [[Western culture|West]], Christianity's myth of [[The fall of man|the fall]], that is the expulsion of humankind from the [[Garden of Eden]], where all creation lived in harmony, into an imperfect world, has been the major influence.<ref>Joanne Vining, Melinda Merrick and Emily Price, "The Distinction between Humans and Nature". ''Human Ecology Review'', vol.15, no. 1, 2008, p. 1</ref> [[Cartesian dualism]], from the seventeenth century on, further reinforced this dualistic thinking about nature.<ref>Vining, Merrick and Price, p. 1.</ref> With this [[Dualism (philosophy of mind)|dualism]] goes value judgement as to [[appeal to nature|the superiority of the natural over the artificial]]. Modern science, however, is moving towards a [[holistic]] view of nature.<ref>Maria Kaika, ''City of Flows: Modernity, Nature, and the City''. (New York: Routledge, 2005), p. 4.</ref>
====America==== What is meant by natural, within the American [[conservation movement]], has been changing over the last century and a half.
In the mid-nineteenth century American began to realize that the land was becoming more and more domesticated and wildlife was disappearing. This led to the creation of [[National Park Service|American National Parks]] and other conservation sites.<ref>Gregory H. Aplett and David N. Cole, "The Trouble with Naturalness: Rethinking Park and Wilderness Goals" in ''Beyond Naturalness: Rethinking Park and Wilderness Stewardshio in an Era of Rapid Change'' (Washington, DC.: Island Press, 2010), pp. 14-15.</ref> Initially it was believed that all that was needed to do was to separate what was seen as natural landscape and "avoid disturbances such as logging, grazing, fire and insect outbreaks".<ref name="Aplett and Cole, p. 15">Aplett and Cole, p. 15.</ref> This, and subsequent environmental policy, until recently, was influenced by ideas of the wilderness.<ref>William Cronon, pp. 72-77</ref> However, this policy was not consistently applied, and in [[Yellowstone Park]], to take one example, the existing ecology was altered, firstly by the exclusion of Native Americans and later with the virtual extermination of the wolf population.<ref name="dow">{{cite web |title=Defenders of Wildlife |work=A Yellowstone Chronology |url=http://www.defenders.org/wildlife/wolf/ynpchro.html |accessdate=2007-03-19 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070607214843/http://www.defenders.org/wildlife/wolf/ynpchro.html |archivedate=7 June 2007}}</ref{{cite book |last=Merchant |first=Carolyn |title=The Columbia Guide to American Environmental History |publisher=Columbia University Press |year=2002 |isbn=978-0-231-11232-1 |url=https://books.google.com/?id=QQQximQsxSgC |page=148}}</ref>
A century later, in the mid-twentieth century, it began to be believed that the earlier policy of "protection from disturbance was inadequate to preserve park values", and that is that direct human intervention was necessary to restore the landscape of National Parks to its ‘’natural’’ condition.<ref name="Aplett and Cole, p. 15"/> In 1963 the [[Leopold Report]] argued that "A national park should represent a vignette of primitive America".<ref>Aplett and Cole, p. 16.</ref> This policy change eventually led to the restoration of [[History of wolves in Yellowstone|wolves in Yellowstone Park]] in the 1990s.
However, recent research in various disciplines indicates that a pristine natural or "primitive" landscape is a myth, and it now realised that people have been changing the natural into a cultural landscape for a long while, and that there are few places untouched in some way from human influence.<ref>Aplett and Cole, p. 18</ref> The earlier conservation policies were now seen as cultural interventions. The idea of what is natural and what artificial or cultural, and how to maintain the natural elements in a landscape, has been further complicated by the discovery of [[global warming]] and how it is changing natural landscapes.<ref>Aplett and Cole, p. 24</ref>
Also important is a reaction recently amongst scholars against dualistic thinking about nature and culture. Maria Kaika comments: "Nowadays, we are beginning to see nature and culture as intertwined once again – not [[ontologically]] separated anymore […].What I used to perceive as a compartmentalized world, consisting of neatly and tightly sealed, autonomous ‘space envelopes’ (the home, the city, and nature) was, in fact, a messy socio-spatial continuum”.<ref>''City of Flows: Modernity, Nature, and the City''. (New York: Routledge, 2005), p. 4.</ref> And William Cronon argues against the idea of wilderness because it "involves a dualistic vision in which the human is entirely outside the natural"<ref>Cronon, p. 78.</ref> and affirms that "wildness (as opposed to wilderness) can be found anywhere" even "in the cracks of a Manhattan sidewalk".<ref name="Cronon, p. 85">Cronon, p. 85.</ref> According to Cronon we have to "abandon the dualism that sees the tree in the garden as artificial […] and the tree in the wilderness as natural […] Both in some ultimate sense are wild."<ref name="Cronon, p. 85"/> Here he bends somewhat the regular dictionary meaning of wild, to emphasise that nothing natural, even in a garden, is fully under human control.
====Europe==== The landscape of Europe has considerably altered by people and even in an area, like the [[Cairngorm Mountains]] of [[Scotland]], with a low population density, only " the high summits of the [[Cairngorm Mountains]], consist entirely of natural elements.<ref>[http://www.snh.gov.uk/about-scotlands-nature/scotlands-landscapes/what-is-landscape/ [[Scottish Natural Heritage]], ]</ref> These ''high summits'' are of course only part of the Cairngorms, and there are no longer wolves, bears, wild boar or lynx in Scotland's wilderness.<ref>Murray (1973)</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/north_east/6155172.stm | title = Extinct Island Pig Spotted Again | publisher = BBC News | date = 17 November 2006 | accessdate =1 January 2007}}</ref><ref name="Fraser Darling and Boyd 1969 64">Fraser Darling and Boyd (1969) p. 64</ref> The [[Scots pine]] in the form of the [[Caledonian forest]] also covered much more of the Scottish landscape than today.<ref>Steven, H. M. & Carlisle, A. (1959). ''The Native Pinewoods of Scotland''. Oliver and Boyd, Edinburgh</ref>
The [[Swiss National Park]], however, represent a more natural landscape. It was founded in 1914, and is one of the earliest national parks in Europe. Visitors are not allowed to leave the motor road, or paths through the park, make fire or camp. The only building within the park is Chamanna Cluozza, [[mountain hut]]. It is also forbidden to disturb the animals or the plants, or to take home anything found in the park. Dogs are not allowed. Due to these strict rules, the Swiss National Park is the only park in the Alps who has been categorized by the [[IUCN]] as a [[strict nature reserve]], which is the highest protection level.<ref>[http://www.unesco.org/mabdb/br/brdir/directory/biores.asp?code=SWI+01&mode=all Parc Suisse Biosphere Reserve]</ref>
==History of natural landscape== No place on the Earth is unaffected by people and their culture. People are part of [[biodiversity]], but human activity affects biodiversity, and this alters the natural landscape.<ref>[http://www.amnh.org/museum/press/feature/biofact.html National Survey Reveals Biodiversity Crisis] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070607101209/http://www.amnh.org/museum/press/feature/biofact.html |date=7 June 2007 }} American Museum of Natural History</ref> Mankind have altered landscape to such an extent that few places on earth remain pristine, but once free of human influences, the landscape can return to a natural or near natural state.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u4uDb0H4V5c YouTube, Professor James Lovelock, We can't save the planet, BBC NEWS, 2010/03/30]</ref>
[[File:Wrangell St. Elias National Park.jpg|thumb| [[Glacier]] on the border between [[Alaska]], US, and Canada: [[Kluane-Wrangell-St. Elias-Glacier Bay-Tatshenshini-Alsek]] park system]] Even the remote [[Yukon]] and [[Alaskan]] wilderness, the bi-national [[Kluane-Wrangell-St. Elias-Glacier Bay-Tatshenshini-Alsek]] park system comprising [[Kluane National Park|Kluane]], [[Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve|Wrangell-St Elias]], [[Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve|Glacier Bay]] and [[Tatshenshini-Alsek Park|Tatshenshini-Alsek]] parks, a [[UNESCO]] [[World Heritage Site]], is not free from human influence, because the [[Kluane National Park]] lies within the traditional territories of the Champagne and Aishihik [[First Nations]] and [[Kluane First Nation]] who have a long history of living in this region. Through their respective Final Agreements with the Canadian Government, they have made into law their rights to harvest in this region.
==Examples of cultural forces== Cultural forces intentionally or unintentionally, have an influence upon the landscape.<ref group = note>[http://lamar.colostate.edu/%7Ehrolston/Technol-vs-Nature-Aberdeen.pdf "It is true that certain human technological actions do have unintended consequences that spread everywhere; there are contagious effects that seep into the nooks and crannies of all nature." Holmes Rolston III, "Technology versus nature, What is natural, Journal of Philosophy and Technology", ''Ends and Means'', Vol 2 No.2 Spring 1998, University of Aberdeen, Edinburgh University Press]</ref> [[Cultural landscapes]] are places or artifacts created and maintained by people. Examples of cultural intrusions into a landscape are: fences, roads, parking lots, sand pits, buildings, hiking trails, management of plants, including the introduction of [[invasive species]], extraction or removal of plants, management of animals, mining, hunting, [[natural landscaping]], farming and forestry, pollution. Areas that might be confused with a natural landscape include [[public park]]s, farms, orchards, artificial lakes and reservoirs, managed forests, golf courses, nature center trails, gardens. [[File:Pony in brecon2.jpg|thumb|A [[Welsh mountain pony]] in the [[Brecon Beacons]] [[National park]], [[Wales]]. Sheep and cattle also graze on this upland]]
==See also== {{portal|Environment}} {{columns-list|colwidth=30em| * [[Cityscape]] * [[Land restoration]] * [[Land use]] * [[Landscape art]] * [[National Parks]] * [[Natural environment]] * [[Romantic movement]] * [[Seascape]]s * [[Skyscape art]] * [[Soundscape]] }}

Sauer, "The Morphology of Landscape" ''University of California Publications in Geography'', vol. 2, No. 2, 12 October 1925, pp. 19–53 (scroll down): [https://archive.org/stream/universityofc02univ/universityofc02univ_djvu.txt]

{{Unreferenced|date=March 2007}} '''Station-keeping''' in a nautical situation is when a vessel is to: * maintain a position in relation to another moving vessel or vessels, such as when ** conducting [[underway replenishment]] or ** part of a [[task force]] or [[convoy]] * maintaining a fixed position in relation to a fixed object or * patrolling a defined sector in relation to a fixed object.
==See also== * [[Dynamic positioning]]
